attributes.comment:
In private business when an organization wants to increase profit or cover
expenses it normally increases it's prices but I have yet to see a private entity
raise prices by an average of 66% without losing clientele. In this case this
service is mandated for adoption and it is like being held hostage to increase fees
by this margin. Surely with new processing and automation, costs can be covered
by the increase of request and still make this a not for profit type business. I
cannot fathom a government entity that has an inherent design to make profit while
it still has the ability to collect taxes. Fees should cover cost and expense and
not be used to profit or fill other coffers. If expenses have made it feasible to raise
the fees to this extent then this is outright poor management and a gradual
increase would be more pallatable. Please do not raise the fees associated with
this proposal as it is absurd to raise them by such an average increase. Let's use
some common sense and not mandate processes with absurd amounts of cost.
Thank you.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Troy T. Brown
